content: My first suggestion is to review the settings carefully on the phone, as it may be that your PC is not setup the same way. The 'not connecting' message indicates that the server name or port number may be wrong.
creator: davidsk

content: FIRST, please STOP creating new posts for every response. Keep this message in your inbox and reply with it. That will keep the messages together. Since you made no changes, my guess is that Norton antivirus may be interfering. There are settings in Norton that let it not interfere with email settings. Since you have posted this problem in the past, this could be a part of that. I do not know what you mean by a Google antivirus, but two antivirus programs is one too many. Desirable screenshots (which may not be needed if the antivirus is the cause) are - click account settings, then server settings. That screenshot would show info on incoming server - click account settings, scroll down left side to 'Outgoing Server (SMTP) and click your outgoing server. That screenshot will provide info on how you are set up for sending.
creator: davidsk

content:
Jamesrsamec41, This is a Support Forum and is not some form of chat or ticket system.

You should post your own replies in the same thread you started vs making brand new threads to make a reply.

The emails that you receive upon replies in your threads are to inform you there are replies in said thread here. They are not emails to reply back to in support as no support is done by email, chat or phone.

You previous threads are https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1433235 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1433270

To make a reply in a thread you scroll down to the Post a Reply box and then click on Post Reply button.
creator: James

content: I don't think there's a way to only open the calendar, but if you want to start without connecting to mail servers, launch in offline mode (Settings/General/Network & Disk Space, Offline...). This will also prevent network calendars and address books from connecting at startup.
creator: sfhowes

content: I discovered the problem: I usually prefer to look at the "All mail" view of Gmail on my phone. This (evidently) doesn't properly reflect the deleted status from Thunderbird (and perhaps from Gmail as well).
creator: spartanhooah

content: Most users unsubscribe All Mail (see All Mail). On my setup, when a message is deleted, with 'just mark as deleted', it's shown with a strikethrough, and is made invisible at the next folder sync. As mentioned in the kb article, if a message is in multiple folders, deleting it by just marking, does not delete it from the other folders. This is a gmail-only property.
creator: sfhowes

content: That is because trash and deleted are part of all mail. I generally recommend not using it as it increases the disk space and causes extra overhead for Thunderbird to update. Your reported problem also happens if you have not specified to Gmail to expunge when marking as deleted.
creator: davidsk

If you just want the addressbook, it can be retrieved by - clicking help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' - click 'open folder' - exit TB - highlight abook.sqlite and copy to the flashdrive

content: We are often able to assist, if you are requesting assistance. Are you? Or is your post just a parting comment? Please understand that those of us on the forum have no involvement in Thunderbird's development. Thank you for sharing your views.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thank you. . Assistance would he great but I suspect only programmers can fix the issues in my example. If you have a solution or workaround I'm listening.

I haven't seen any evidence that programmers are listening. I keep manually checking for updates. I guess I'm expressing desperation. Loss of hope too.

I've implemented a number of the workarounds to restore functionality. It is possible that those create bugs which won't be fixed. If I can't compose email than all I can do to extend staying with Thunderbird is to compose via webmail. I think you would agree that is a particularly kludgy workaround.

There have been so many problems since the redesign that at this point there doesn't seem to be any hope left. Going back to a pre-redesign version that just works is possible. Then I would have to prevent updates and I would be eternally missing security updates and be unsafe using the software. I don't see any path forward for Thunderbird. It is broken. This bird is on the endangered species list.
creator: Rubberfish

content: Thank you. I will be sure to share your views upward. I regret you were not able to get Thunderbird to function as you needed.
creator: davidsk

content: I'm a bit confused. If you specify a folder view mode, that tells Thunderbird what folders you want viewable. So, the clicking for a folder elsewhere should be to be within the limits that you had defined. So, the system is working properly. What am I missing? Thanks for sharing this.
creator: davidsk

content:
Well, you can have structured your messages in many folders (different mailboxes, news feeds, etc) that would overflow the left pane if you set your view to All Folders. So you set Favourites to reduce the clutter, and use Unread to only add folders to the left pane as messages come in (I use message filters to send incoming messages to appropriate folders).

In my mind, the Switch to folder icon should not be limited to switch to a folder that you can already see in the left pane, but rather to switch to any folder part of your setup, especially one that is not currently shown in the left pane.

It's almost there, as that the drop down menu gives you all your folders, it's just that it doesn't switch to the selected folder if the view is not already All Folders.

content: Since the issue is an embedded attachment, the filelink one is my guess. the import/export is widely used and not generally an issue here. I suggest disabling both, closing and restarting TB and testing again. If all works, then remove the filelink addon and, as you see appropriate, notify the author. Let us know.
creator: davidsk

content: THunderbird reads the profile.ini file at c:\users?\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird. That text file points to the correct profile. If that profile does not exist, you get the message you mentioned and TB shuts down. If you KNOW where the profile is, you can edit the profiles.ini with notepad. If you just want to start over, then reinstall thunderbird and it will set up a blank profile to use.
creator: davidsk

content:
I regret your decision, as thousands like the new Thunderbird. BUT, it's your decision. To downgrade, Try: 

   Exit Thunderbird if running.    click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

The latest version prior to 115 was 102
